Message.MsgText: Failed to parse administrative request {0}: RC={1}.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} has received an invalid administrative request. The JSON request string is invalid.

OperatorResponse.p: Check server log entry for more information.

Message.MsgText: Invalid administrative action {0} from the user: UserID={1}.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} has received an invalid administrative action.

OperatorResponse.p: Check server log entry for more information.

Message.MsgText: Processing administrative action {0} from the user: UserID={1}.

Explanation.p: An user has invoked an administrative action.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} server is stopping.

Explanation.p: Administrator has invoked ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} 'stop' command.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: User is not authorized to invoke {1}: UserID={0}.

Explanation.p: The user is not authorized to invoke the action.

OperatorResponse.p: Check if user has administrative role.

Message.MsgText: Trace buffer is flushed.

Explanation.p: The memory trace is written to the trace file.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Option is not yet implemented.

Explanation.p: The requested option is not yet implemented.

OperatorResponse.p: Check ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation to determine if the requested option is implemented.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} version is {0} {1}{2}

Explanation.p: Displays ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} version number.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The requested configuration change has completed successfully.

Explanation.p: A configuration change has completed successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} runmode is set to {0}. For it to take effect, you must restart the server process using REST calls to restart the server.

Explanation.p: Administrator has changed ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode to 'Maintenance'.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Administration service is initialized: RunMode={0}.

Explanation.p: Administration service of ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL is initialized successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Processing administrative request buffer: {0}

Explanation.p: Server is processing an administrative action.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: This cluster member, which is the last server that is connected in the cluster has left the cluster. The server received no acknowledgment of this action.

Explanation.p: When the last server that is connected in a cluster leaves the cluster, no acknowledgment of this action is generated for the server as part of normal operation. This message is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The connection is authorized to initiate action {0} : ClientAddress={1}.

Explanation.p: The connection is authorized to take specified action.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Connection is not authorized. The connection identifiers are: Endpoint={0}, UserID={1}, ClientIPAddress={2}, CertificateCommonName={3}

Explanation.p: The connection is not authorized to take specified action.

OperatorResponse.p: Review logs and all configuration policies.

Message.MsgText: The connection policy {0} has authorized a connection. The connection identifiers are: Endpoint={1}, UserID={2}, ClientID={3}, ClientIPAddress={4}, CertificateCommonName={5}, Protocol={6}.

Explanation.p: A connection policy has successfully authorized a connection.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Connection is not authorized. The connection identifiers are: Endpoint={0}, UserID={1}, ClientID={2}, ClientIPAddress={3}, CertificateCommonName={4}, Protocol={5}.

Explanation.p: The connection is not authorized.

OperatorResponse.p: Review connection log and configured connection policies.

Message.MsgText: The messaging policy {0} has authorized a client to {1} on Destination {2}. The connection identifiers are: Endpoint={3}, UserID={4}, ClientID={5}, ClientIPAddress={6}, CertificateCommonName={7}, Protocol={8}.

Explanation.p: A messaging policy has successfully authorized a client to publish or subscribe.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: A client is not authorized to {0} on Destination {1}. The connection identifiers are: Endpoint={2}, UserID={3}, ClientID={4}, ClientIPAddress={5}, CertificateCommonName={6}, Protocol={7}.

Explanation.p: A client is not authorized to publish, subscribe, receive or send.

OperatorResponse.p: Review logs and configured messaging policies.
No action is required.

Message.MsgText: User authentication failed: ConnectionID={0}, UserID={1}, Endpoint={2}, ClientID={3}, ClientAddress={4}, Error={5}, RC={6}.

Explanation.p: A user could not be authenticated. A possible cause is that the user ID or password is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the user credential is valid.

Message.MsgText: User authentication succeeded: ConnectionID={0}, UserID={1}, Endpoint={2}, ClientID={3}, ClientAddress={4}.

Explanation.p: The user is authenticated.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required

Message.MsgText: Security in ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} is initialized.

Explanation.p: The Security service in ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is initialized successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is in {0} mode.

Explanation.p: The current mode of the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: High Availability mode change {0} is initiated.

Explanation.p: High Availability mode of the system is changing from Standby to Primary. Either the Primary node has stopped or there is a communication problem between Primary and Secondary node.

OperatorResponse.p: Check Primary node for any failure. Check for networking issues.

Message.MsgText: High Availability state transfer is initiated on the Primary node.

Explanation.p: A High Availability Standby node has connected to the system. The system will transfer its configuration state to the Standby node.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: High Availability node has received an Administrative message from the Primary node.

Explanation.p: A High Availability Standby node has received an Administrative message from the Primary node.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: High Availability node has received an Administrative message from the Primary node.

Explanation.p: A High Availability Standby node has received an Administrative message from the Primary node.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Failed to transfer {0} to Standby node: RC={1}.

Explanation.p: During node synchronization, Primary node failed to transfer a configuration file to the Standby node.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: Incorrect UEFI setting detected: {0}.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detected that UEFI settings are incorrect, preventing it from starting properly.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Configuration Error is detected in {0} configuration item. {1}={2}, Error={3}, RC={4}

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detected that a messaging configuration setting could not be applied.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: Configuration Error was detected in {0}. Error String: {1}. RC: {2}.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detected that a messaging configuration setting could not be applied.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} detects an error. The error code is {0}. The error string is {1}.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} encountered an error during runtime.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} status is {0}. Any actions to {1} are not allowed.

Explanation.p: The action is not allowed because the status of ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is 'Standby'.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is running and the status is 'Standby'.

Message.MsgText: Cannot run CleanStore. The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is not running in Maintenance mode. Use a REST call to set run mode.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode 'CleanStore' requires ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is in 'Maintenance' .

OperatorResponse.p: Change ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode to 'Maintenance', restart imaserver then try the command again.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is in {0} mode with {1} action pending.

Explanation.p: The current mode of the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} with CleanStore action pending.

OperatorResponse.p: Restart imaserver and try the command again.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is currently in {0} mode. When it is restarted, it will be in {1} mode.

Explanation.p: Administrator has changed ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode. The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} restart is required.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is restarted.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is currently in {0} mode with {1} action pending. When it is restarted, it will be in {2} mode.

Explanation.p: Administrator has changed ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode. The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} restart is required.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is restarted.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is in maintenance mode however the configured mode is production.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is in maintenance mode however the configured mode not maintenance.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that configuration errors are addressed.

Message.MsgText: The rule specified as the {0} is not valid. Policy name={1}. {2}={3}. Return code={4}.

Explanation.p: The rule in the Destination or ClientID configuration item is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the rules in the policy are valid.

Message.MsgText: Invalid administrative action {0} from the user: UserID={1} RequestBuffer={2}

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} has received an invalid administrative action.

OperatorResponse.p: Check server log entry for more information.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} encountered an error while processing an administration request. The error code is {0}. The error string is {1}.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} encountered an error while processing an administration request.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: Policy evaluated for {0}={1} to {2}: PolicyName={3}, Error={4} RC={5}

Explanation.p: This message includes failure details for the policy used to authorize the client.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: {0} days {1} hours {2} minutes {3} seconds

Explanation.p: Displays ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} Uptime.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Test connection succeeded.

Explanation.p: Test connection succeeded.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The transaction branch has been {0}.

Explanation.p: The action against the transaction branch has completed successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Cannot run CleanStore. The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} restart is required to change to Maintenance mode. Use REST calls to restart the server.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode 'CleanStore' requires ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is in 'Maintenance' .

OperatorResponse.p: Change ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode to 'Maintenance', restart imaserver then try the command again.

Message.MsgText: Cannot run CleanStore. Due to an internal error, the server status is set to Maintenance, however the configured mode is Production. Use a REST call to get more information about the server status.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode 'CleanStore' requires ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is in 'Maintenance' .

OperatorResponse.p: Change ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} run mode to 'Maintenance', restart imaserver then try the command again.

Message.MsgText: The specified connection was not closed. The specified connection cannot be found.

Explanation.p: The action did not complete successfully. The specified connection cannot be found.

OperatorResponse.p: Use a REST call to check the list of connections. Check the server log for more information.

Message.MsgText: The specified connections were closed. Number of connections closed = {0}

Explanation.p: The action completed successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Failed to apply updates to the plug-in. Name={0}. RC={1}

Explanation.p: This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to remove the plug-in from the staging directory. Name={0}. RC={1}

Explanation.p: This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to delete the plug-in. Name={0}. RC={1}

Explanation.p: This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to delete the plug-in from the staging directory. Name={0}. RC={1}

Explanation.p: This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to install the plug-in. Name={0}. RC={1}

Explanation.p: This is an internal ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Upgrading ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Unable to find image: {0}

Explanation.p: The specified upgrade image is not available.

OperatorResponse.p: Use file command to upload upgrade image.

Message.MsgText: Extracting packages from image ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Validating image ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Stopping ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} services ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Creating configuration backup file ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Executing pre install script ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Installing operating system patches ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Upgrading ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} services ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Executing post install script ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Starting ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} services ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Deleting temporary files ...

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is upgraded. Restarting server.

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Failed to upgrade or install {0}.

Explanation.p: Failed to upgrade or install the specified package.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Roll back applied changes.

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Failed to execute pre install script.

Explanation.p: Failed to execute pre install script.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to execute post install script.

Explanation.p: Failed to execute post install script.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: Rolling back to last known version of ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Roll back ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} services.

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Current version is the last known installed version:

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} server license usage is {0}.

Explanation.p: This is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The connection is not authorized because OAuth authentication failed. ClientID={0}, AuthorizationToken={1}, Error={2}, RC={3}

Explanation.p: Either the OAuth authorization token is invalid, or the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} could not connect to the OAuth resource server.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the log message and error code in the message to determine the problem.

Message.MsgText: The name of {0} has a value which has exceeded the maximum length of {1} characters.

Explanation.p: The maximum length for the name of the property was reached.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Refer to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for more details.

Message.MsgText: The name of {0} must only contain alphanumeric characters.

Explanation.p: Some characters in the name of the property are not allowed.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Refer to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation for more details.

Message.MsgText: The {0} and {1} parameters are needed for the REST call.

Explanation.p: The parameters are required for configuring the object.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the parameters for the REST call are valid. Refer to the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for more details.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} will be restarted to complete the configuration changes.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is restarted to complete the configuration changes.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Cannot find the PreShared key file {0}. Make sure it has been uploaded.

Explanation.p: The PreShared key file is not uploaded.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the PreShared key file has been uploaded.

Message.MsgText: The file {0} already exists. Set Overwrite to true to replace the existing file.

Explanation.p: The file already exists.

OperatorResponse.p: If you want to overwrite the file, set the option 'OverWrite' to true.

Message.MsgText: The {0} or {1} already exists. Set Overwrite to true to replace the existing file.

Explanation.p: The file already exists.

OperatorResponse.p: If you want to overwrite the file, set the option 'OverWrite' to true.

Message.MsgText: The {0} directory has been created or recreated.

Explanation.p: A directory that is required by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} either does exist or has been removed from the application. The directory has been created to ensure continued administrative operations.

OperatorResponse.p: If the original directory was on a separate file system stop the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}, map the directory correctly, and restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.

Message.MsgText: The {0} ClientSet with request ID {1} has been deleted.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} successfully deleted an import or export request of a ClientSet.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The {0} ClientSet request with request ID {1} failed with reason {2} associated ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} message number ({3}).

Explanation.p: a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} import or export request failed with the specified reason.

OperatorResponse.p: Examine the diagnostic information provided to determine the reason for the failure.

Message.MsgText: Import or export files marked in-progress for ClientSet move requests cannot be cleaned up. Check the trace.

Explanation.p: An import or export request for a ClientSet was in progress before ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} was stopped or restarted. The request cannot be completed.

OperatorResponse.p: Initiate a REST API call to force the deletion of the requests that are in progress. Refer to the IBM IoT MesageSight documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for information about how to initiate such requests.

Message.MsgText: The {0} request for ClientSet with request ID {1} is in progress.

Explanation.p: The import or export request for a ClientSet is in progress.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The {0} request for ClientSet with request ID {1} has completed.

Explanation.p: An import or export request for a ClientSet has completed.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The {0} request for ClientSet with request ID {1} was not found.

Explanation.p: The import or export request issued with the specified request ID given was not found.

OperatorResponse.p: Retry the REST API call with the correct request ID.

Message.MsgText: The certificate failed the verification.

Explanation.p: The certificate specified is invalid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the certificate specified can pass SSL verification.

Message.MsgText: The certificate must be in PEM format.

Explanation.p: The certificate specified is not in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the certificate is in PEM format.

Message.MsgText: The certificate must be in PEM format.

Explanation.p: The certificate specified is not in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format, PKCS #12 format, or PFX format.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the certificate is in supported format.

Message.MsgText: The certificate is not a CA certificate.

Explanation.p: The certificate specified must be a certificate authority (CA) certificate.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the certificate is a CA certificate.

Message.MsgText: Cannot find the certificate file {0}. Make sure it has been uploaded.

Explanation.p: The option is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: Cannot find the key file {0}. Make sure it has been uploaded.

Explanation.p: The option is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the file specified for the command has been uploaded successfully.

Message.MsgText: The certificate already exists. Set Overwrite to true to replace the existing certificate.

Explanation.p: The certificate already exists.

OperatorResponse.p: If you want to overwrite the certfiicate, set the option 'Overwrite' to true.

Message.MsgText: Store the certificate into ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} keystore failed.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Store the key file into ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} keystore failed.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: The certificate and key file do not match.

Explanation.p: The certificate and key file must match.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: An error occurred while verifying the key file. Error returned: unable to load Private Key.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} encountered an error when it tried to validate the key file.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. See the REST API reference information in the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for details about command options.

Message.MsgText: The key file specified has a password. Need to input a KeyFilePassword.

Explanation.p: Password is required for the key file.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The certificate file might be in an unexpected format, or the certificate password might be incorrect or missing.

Explanation.p: The certficate is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: See the error in the message text for more information.

Message.MsgText: The key file might be in an unexpected format, or the key password might be incorrect or missing.

Explanation.p: The certficate is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: See the error in the message text for more information.

Message.MsgText: The certificate file specified has a password. Need to input a CertFilePassword.

Explanation.p: The password for the certficate is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that you enter a valid password for the certificate. See the REST API reference information in the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} documentation in IBM Knowledge Center for details about command options.

Message.MsgText: The request is pending

Explanation.p: The request is waiting to be run.

OperatorResponse.p: Check again after the request has had a chance to be run.

Message.MsgText: The request is being processed. Clients found: {0}, Clients deleted: {1}, Deletion errors: {2}

Explanation.p: The request is currently being run.

OperatorResponse.p: Check again after the request has had a chance to complete.

Message.MsgText: The request is complete. Clients found: {0}, Clients deleted: {1}, Deletion errors: {2}

Explanation.p: The request has run.

OperatorResponse.p: No action necessary.

Message.MsgText: The requested item {0} is not found.

Explanation.p: The object does not exist.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the object name is valid.

Message.MsgText: You must specify both a KeyFileName and a Password.

Explanation.p: One or more required items are not specified.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that all the required configuration items are specified for the command. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: LTPA KeyFile is not valid, or the KeyFile and Password do not match.

Explanation.p: Either the KeyFile is not valid, or the KeyFile and Password do not match.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the LTPA KeyFile and Password are valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The {0} already exists. Set Overwrite:true to update the existing configuration.

Explanation.p: The configuration object already exists.

OperatorResponse.p: If you want to overwrite the configuration object, set the option 'Overwrite' to true.

Message.MsgText: The KeyFile {0} cannot be converted to UNIX format. Convert the file before upload.

Explanation.p: The LTPA keyfile cannot be converted to UNIX format.

OperatorResponse.p: Convert the file to UNIX format manually before upload.

Message.MsgText: The {0} {1} is used by another {2}.

Explanation.p: The object name is already used.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the object name is unique.

Message.MsgText: Cannot process close/connection REST call. Specify one or more of the following items: UserID, ClientID, ClientAddress.

Explanation.p: One or more required items are not specified.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that all the required configuration items are specified for the command. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The property {0} has a value which has exceeded the maximum length of {1} characters.

Explanation.p: The maximum length for the property value was reached.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the options for the command are valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The property {0} must only contain alphanumeric characters.

Explanation.p: Some characters in the property are not allowed.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the property for the command only contains alphanumeric characters. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The {0} cannot be set to {1} because the LTPAProfile or AllowNullPassword is set.

Explanation.p: The configuration object cannot be set to the value since the LTPAProfile or AllowNullPassword is set.

OperatorResponse.p: If the configuration object is required to set to the value, change the 'LTPAProfile= or AllowNullPassword=' and run command again.

Message.MsgText: Updates to the {0} configuration item are not allowed.

Explanation.p: The configuration item cannot be updated.

OperatorResponse.p: Do not attempt to update this configuration item.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} status is {0}. Any actions to {1} are not allowed.

Explanation.p: The action is not allowed because the status of ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is 'Running'.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is running and the status is 'Running'.

Message.MsgText: The Destination or Source for RuleType={0} is not valid.

Explanation.p: The Destination or Source configuration item is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the command is valid. Use the help command for more details.

Message.MsgText: The RetainedMessages cannot be set to {0} when the Destination is a queue.

Explanation.p: The destination mapping rule type must not target a queue if messages are retained.

OperatorResponse.p: If retained messages are required, change the destination mapping rule to use a topic or topic subtree as the destination.

Message.MsgText: The RetainedMessages cannot be set to {0} when multiple queue manager connections are selected.

Explanation.p: The destination mapping rule must have exactly one queue manager connection if messages are retained.

OperatorResponse.p: If retained messages are required, remove all but one queue manager connection.

Message.MsgText: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup file is either truncated or damaged, perhaps due to incorrect internal offsets, in such a way that it appears to be truncated.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: The structure of the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup file is invalid; for example, it may have been corrupted by a text-mode transfer.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup was unable to allocate sufficient memory to complete the command.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Testing ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup file failed due to errors in the archive, insufficient memory, or inability to find UnZip command.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup was interrupted by user (or superuser) action.

Explanation.p: This message is for informational purposes only.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup encountered an error creating or using a temporary file.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Reading or seeking (jumping) within an input file failed.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup encountered an error writing to an output file (typically the archive); for example, the disk may be full.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup could not open an output file (typically the archive) for writing.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} backup could not open a specified file for reading; either it does not exist or does not have permission to read it.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Restore file {0} does not exist.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Temporary directory for restore file {0} has not been created.

Explanation.p: A temporary directory for restoring was not created. The restoring process failed.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the restore file uploaded correctly.

Message.MsgText: Failed to stop imaserver.

Explanation.p: Cannot stop the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} during restore process.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} is in normal 'Running' state before restoring.

Message.MsgText: Failed to stop MQ Connectivity.

Explanation.p: Cannot stop MQ Connectivity during restore process.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that mqconnectivity is in normal 'Active' state before restoring.

Message.MsgText: Failed to stop openldap.

Explanation.p: Cannot stop internal LDAP during restore process.

OperatorResponse.p: If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Cannot find imaBackup.lst in the restore file {0}.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: The restore file is not valid. Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to update configuration with restore file {0}.

Explanation.p: Cannot restore the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} using the restore file provided.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the restore file was the one orginally generated by the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} backup process. If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Failed to start the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.

Explanation.p: Cannot start the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} during restore process.

OperatorResponse.p: If the problem persists, contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} restore file decryption failed due to the bad password.

Explanation.p: The wrong password was provided.

OperatorResponse.p: Retry the operation with the correct password.

Message.MsgText: {0} data integrity check failed.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: Cannot access ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} trusted store.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} trusted store does not exist.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Cannot open security profile {0}.

Explanation.p: This is a ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} internal error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact IBM Support.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetDescriptor defined and in use.

Explanation.p: The ResourceSetDescriptor defined by the Topic and/or ClientID are currently in use.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetDescriptor currently defined and not in use, but will be after server restart.

Explanation.p: ResourceSetDescriptor is defined but cannot take effect until a server restart.

OperatorResponse.p: Please restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} for the defined ResourceSetDescriptor to take effect.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetDescriptor defined and in use, will be altered after server restart.

Explanation.p: The currently defined ResourceSetDescriptor will be altered after a server restart.

OperatorResponse.p: Please restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} for the new ResourceSetDescriptor to take effect.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetDescriptor currently defined will be deleted after server restart.

Explanation.p: The currently defined ResourceSetDescriptor will no longer be in use after a server restart.

OperatorResponse.p: Please restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME} to delete the currently defined ResourceSetDescriptor.

Message.MsgText: No ResourceSetDescriptor currently defined.

Explanation.p: The ResourceSetDescriptor is not defined. No filtered statistics will be proided.

OperatorResponse.p: Please update the configuration item: ResourceSetDescriptor and restart the ${IMA_SVR_COMPONENT_NAME}.

Message.MsgText: The SubLevel cannot be set when the Source is not an a mq topic or topic subtree.

Explanation.p: The destination mapping rule type must use an mq topic or topic subtree.

OperatorResponse.p: Change the destination mapping rule to use an mq topic or topic subtree as the source.
